description: Borrowed from Guugu Yimidhirr gangurru (“eastern grey kangaroo”).

examples: The rapid growth in Kangaroo bond issues in the Australian market has given  rise to an interest in the nature, trend and impact of this type of bond on  Australia's international investment statistics. While Kangaroo bonds have been  issued for a ...

entries.meaning: (finance, investments) Characterized by rapidly jumping prices in securities markets or by belief that the prices are unstable in contrast to bear and bull markets.
A member of the Macropodidae family of large marsupials with strong hind legs for hopping, native to Australia. [from 18th c.]
examples: Besides the Animals which I have before mentioned, called by the Natives Kangooroo, or Kanguru […].

entries.meaning: (Canada, attributive) A hooded jacket with a front pocket, usually of fleece material, a kangaroo jacket.

verbs.description: kangaroo (third-person singular simple present kangaroos, present participle kangarooing, simple past and past participle kangarooed)

entries.meaning: To practice kangaroo care on an infant; to hold a premature infant against the skin.
